revised_title: Quantitative Study of Bacteria Sensitivity to Ultra-Violet Light
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the effect of different wavelengths of ultra-violet light on the growth of various bacteria species. They found that bacteria have varying levels of sensitivity to different wavelengths of ultra-violet light, and that exposure to certain wavelengths can significantly reduce bacterial growth. The study also introduced a new technique for measuring bacterial growth using a photoelectric effect.
